Html:
The Ice Spire Sceptor seems to me to be a legitimate Healadin weapon considering that it's a 1H mace with 461 SP and 38 Haste, but I can't get Rawr to list it or allow it as a gear option.

MaxDps.com lists it as better than the Grieving Spellblade, which is what I'm using now, but I can't tell how Rawr rates it. How do I get it into the list?

It seems the Healadin module is strongly opposed to using items that have spirit on them.

Quick workaround: Go Tools->Edit Items, Search for it using the filter and edit it to set the spirit to 0. Now it should show up in the list.
Seems silly that it's left off the list just because it has Spirit on it, but that did indeed work. Thanks.

The same logic appears to apply if a weapon has +hit. The Blade of the Keening Banshee has 0 spirit, but was still not being listed as a Healadin main-hand weapon. Editing the item to remove its +29 hit caused it to appear.

Is an update to the Healadin module in the works? It seems odd to discount weapons with irrelevant stats--their other stats may make the weapon a viable choice, especially as Blizzard seems to be heading towards making items more general in terms of their applicability.

In the current (as yet unreleased) code base, Ermad has added two check boxes to the Healadin "Options" tab: "Ignore Spirit Items" and "Ignore Hit Items". Having downloaded, built and tested it, I can say that it addresses the issues raised here perfectly (i.e., items with hit and/or spirit will now be listed if the check boxes are unchecked). Thank you!
